svg.text: "The sum of currents entering a node equals the sum of currents leaving the node"
Conservation of charge - no charge accumulates at a node

g.text: • Set up node equations using KCL
• Express branch currents in terms of node voltages

svg.text: "The sum of voltage rises equals the sum of voltage drops around any closed loop"
Conservation of energy - no energy is created or destroyed

g.text: • Write KVL equations for each loop
Loop 1 (I₁): V₁ → R₁ → R₃ → back to V₁
Loop 2 (I₂): R₃ → R₂ → V₂ → back to R₃
Note: (I₁ - I₂) is current through R₃
Step 5: Calculate Branch Currents and Voltages
Power: P = I²R for each component

svg.text: • Best for: many nodes, few loops
• Best for: many loops, few nodes
KCL → Charge conservation, KVL → Energy conservation
Current direction and voltage polarity must be consistent
Power system analysis, electronic circuit design, network theory
Large circuits solved using matrix algebra and computers
Always check: power balance, current/voltage values reasonable
